title: 2007–08 Maltese Premier League
text:
The 2007–08 Maltese Premier League (known as the <a href="Bank%20of%20Valletta">BOV</a> Premier League for sponsorship reasons) was the 28th season of the <a href="Maltese%20Premier%20League">Maltese Premier League</a>, and the 93rd season of top-level league <a href="association%20football">football</a> in <a href="Malta">Malta</a>. <a href="Valletta%20F.C.">Valletta</a> won their nineteenth league title overcoming last season's champions, <a href="Marsaxlokk%20F.C.">Marsaxlokk</a>.
Teams.
The following teams were promoted from the <a href="Maltese%20First%20Division">First Division</a> at the start of the season:
From the previous Premier League season, the following teams were relegated to the First Division:
Second round.
Championship Pool.
The teams placed in the first six positions in the league table qualified for the Championship Pool, and the points obtained during the first round were halved (and rounded up) before the start of second round. As a result, the teams started with the following points before the second round: Valletta 18 points, Marsaxlokk 16, Sliema Wanderers 16, Floriana 14, Birkirkara 13 and Ħamrun Spartans 13.
Relegation Pool.
The teams which finished in the last four league positions were placed in the Relegation Pool and at the end of the round the two lowest-placed teams were <a href="promotion%20and%20relegation">relegated</a> to the First Division. The points obtained during the first round were halved (and rounded up) before the start of second round. As a result, the teams started with the following points before the second round: Hibernians 12 points, Msida Saint-Joseph 10, Pietà Hotspurs 7, Mqabba 3.
Awards.
Annual awards.
Winners are listed first and highlighted in boldface.
